subject: World Cup (Skiing)
Skiing
lead_paragraph: The Olympic skier Michelle Roark had a rock-solid final run to win the women’s World Cup moguls event at snowy Whiteface Mountain. The Olympic champion Dale Begg-Smith of Australia won the men’s event in Lake Placid, N.Y.Roark qualified fifth, but her back flip off the top jump and her bronco (a full rotation with her skis kicked out midway through the spin) on the bottom jump were worth 24.20 points. The runner-up, at 24.13, was Ekaterina Stolyarova of Russia on the final day of the Nature Valley Freestyle Cup schedule..
